[[Image:Chroyane Riley.png|thumb|250px|Riley discussing Season 5.]]
'''Deborah Riley'''Â (born May 16, 1973) is an Australian production designer and art director. She holds dual Australian and United Kingdom citizenship. She spent most of her previous career in film, working as a Set Director on ''The Matrix'' (1999), an Assistant Art Director on ''Anna and the King'' (1999), an Assistant Art Director on ''Moulin Rouge'' (2001), an Art Director on ''21 Grams'' (2003).

Riley became the new lead Production Designer on ''Game of Thrones'' starting in [[Season 4]], replacing [[Gemma Jackson]].<ref>[http://winteriscoming.net/2014/02/season-4-behind-the-scenes-video-introduces-new-production-designer/ ]</ref>
